intro: Thevetia yccotli var. glabra, commonly known as the Mexican buttercup, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow, spurred flowers. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven leaflets, and it produces pods that contain several seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant color and unique floral structure. However, it is important to note that all parts of the plant are toxic and should be handled with care.
